author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Hindu Young World painting competition 2016 will be held on March 26 in Chennai, at the SBOA School & Junior College, Anna Nagar West Extension.

Registrations for the event will begin at 9 a.m. and the event will start at 9.30 a.m. Srinavasan Natarajan, renowned artist, will be the chief guest at the event.

Selected students would have received an intimation from The Hindu . .

Finalists need to come to the venue with their intimation letter at their own cost.

Participants need to remember to avoid using sketch pens and marker pens.

Paper will be distributed by the organisers at the venue and the finale topic will be announced there.

The judges’ decision will be final.

The paintings become the sole property of The Hindu and will not be returned.

The prize distribution will be on the same day at 1 p.m. Every participant will receive a participation certificate. Apart from the first, second and third prizes, there will be consolation prizes too.
title: Young World painting contest tomorrow
